segments.text: I see the water spilling over the sink, and it’s just getting worse and worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right there, but she’s not doing anything about it—it’s frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in the water, and she doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she’s completely unaware of what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool, and it’s about to tip—this is so dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel so bad for them—they’re going to get hurt or in trouble if they’re not careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is ruining the floor, and she’s just drying dishes like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how careless everyone is being right now—it’s unbelievable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene is just filled with so many things going wrong, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR
